title: Journal, Výtvarné snahy (Art endeavors), 1928-1929, 1928–1929
provenance: Purchased by the Margery F. Masinter Endowment for the Smithsonian Design Library, NK1471 .C9V98
creditline: Purchased by the Margery F. Masinter Endowment for the National Design Library, Smithsonian Design Library
description: Two large letterforms are overlaid with two contrasting colorways which bisect the upper and lower halves of the letters. On the upper left and lower right, letters are rendered in white set on a red background. On the upper right and lower left, the letterforms are set in red on a white background, overlaid with evenly spaced black lines. Text framed by black lines above and below frames the upper and lower edges.
label_text: Sutnar was art editor of the Prague publishing house Drustevní Prace [Cooperative Works] from 1929 to 1939. These covers for a modern Czech art magazine use basic geometric shapes and typographic elements in an abstract manner, reflecting the influence of the international Constructivist movement.

tombstone.epitaph:
Journal, Výtvarné snahy (Art endeavors), 1928-1929, 1928–1929. Offset Lithograph. 
Purchased by the Margery F. Masinter Endowment for the National Design Library, Smithsonian Design Library. 2.2015.4
